content:
Hey, we are getting quite close to fixing the last blocking bugs for min_const_generics and I would like to open a bunch of topics to discuss some interesting edge cases, diagnostics and future compat concerns and so on and would prefer to do so in a separate stream.

That would allow me to not worry about drowning out other topics and would mean that everything stays in one place. Does this sound like a good idea?
We have working groups already for several other language features, so I think now could be a good time to start a const generics WG.
we already have a const generics project group
i think the main issue here was that because of the foundation work nikomatsakis didn't have the capacity to go ahead and I dont know what the next steps should be here
Looks like I'm a bit out of touch: a project group is essentially a WG but with lang team prioritisation (whatever that means concretely)?
In that case, it seems sensible to have a dedicated stream.
(I don't have the power to create a new stream, though.)

a project group is essentially a WG but with lang team prioritisation (whatever that means concretely)?

I think so, also not completely sure about where const generics fits in here though as it requires a lot of work by both t-lang and t-compiler
I can make a #project-const-generics stream, similar to the other project groups, if desired?
